Title: $C([0, 1])$ is not complete with respect to the norm $\lVert f\rVert _1 = \int_0^1 \lvert f (x) \rvert \,dx$
AcceptedAnswer:
Let $m\leq n$ both natural numbers, then
$$\|f_n-f_m\|_1 = \int_0^1 |f_n(x)-f_m(x)|\,\mathrm{d}x $$
$$ = \int_\frac{1}{2}^{\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{n}}(n-m)\left(x-\frac{1}{2}\right)\,\mathrm{d}x + \int_{\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{n}}^{\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{m}}\left(1-m\left(x-\frac{1}{2}\right)\right)\,\mathrm{d}x.$$ Now try to bound these integrals for $n,m\geq N$.
